result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Eugene K Schmidt not in court, Attorney Anne Renc for Eugene K Schmidt appeared in court. 
Both files heard: 22CF103, 22CM12

Atty Cassidy calls the cases.  Defendant was present on video conferencing, however they received info that they were getting too close to their intake time and the matter to be rescheduled. 
Defendant is in Marathon County. 
Atty Renc asks to do this on a different day as this is now the 3rd time this has happened. 
Court questions the parties. 
Atty Renc responds. 
Court suggests contacting the Branch 1 judge to schedule. 
Atty Renc asks to meet with the JA to set up a time. 
Atty Cassidy indicates she is not the attorney on this case.  The matter will need to be scheduled with Atty Jambois. 
Court questions Atty Renc regarding the custody status of the defendant. 
Atty Renc responds.
